name: Forest Economy Champs
title: Forests Fuel the Economy
description: In 2021, forest rents contributed a significant 18.4% to the Solomon Islands' GDP, highlighting the country's reliance on its rich forest resources.

name: Education Hurdles
title: Low School Intake Rates
description: In 2018, the net intake rate for grade 1 was notably low, with only 9.5% for females and 8.9% for males, indicating challenges in primary education enrollment.

name: Health Spending Squeeze
title: Minimal Private Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, domestic private health expenditure per capita was just $3.65, reflecting limited private investment in health services.

name: Women at Work
title: High Female Employment Ratio
description: In 2024, the employment to population ratio for females aged 15+ was an impressive 81.2%, showcasing strong female participation in the workforce.

name: Family Workforce
title: High Rate of Family Workers
description: In 2023, contributing family workers made up 49.3% of total employment, with 35.5% of male employment, indicating a reliance on family-based work.

name: Tourism Transport Costs
title: High Transport Expenditure for Tourists
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures for passenger transport items reached $10,000, suggesting high costs associated with travel to the islands.

name: Tariff Titans
title: High Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: In 2022, the Solomon Islands applied a weighted mean tariff rate of 48.8% on primary products, one of the highest globally, affecting trade dynamics.

name: Agricultural Export Leaders
title: Dominance in Agricultural Exports
description: In 2018, agricultural raw materials made up 73.3% of merchandise exports, underscoring the country's strong agricultural export sector.
